data.title: Mart Stam
data.meta_description: Born 5 August 1899 Purmerend, Netherlands. Died 23 February 1986 Goldach, Switzerland. 1917–19 Drawing lessons in Amsterdam. 1919–22 Works in the office of the architect Marinus Jan Granpré Molière in Rotterdam, Netherlands. 1922/23 Works for Max Taut and Hans Poelzig, among others, during a prolonged stay in Berlin. 1
data.text: Born 5 August 1899 Purmerend, Netherlands. Died 23 February 1986 Goldach, Switzerland. 1917–19 Drawing lessons in Amsterdam. 1919–22 Works in the office of the architect Marinus Jan Granpré Molière in Rotterdam, Netherlands. 1922/23 Works for Max Taut and Hans Poelzig, among others, during a prolonged stay in Berlin. 1923–25 Works for the architect Karl Moser in Zurich and for Johannes Itten in Thun, Switzerland. 1924 Co-founder of the Swiss avant-garde magazine ABC – Beiträge zum Bauen. 1926–28 Returns to Netherlands and works for Brinkman & Van de Vlugt at the Van Nelle factory in Rotterdam; designs three single-family dwellings for the Weißenhofsiedlung in Stuttgart; designs a chair without back legs. Show more information
